alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Franklin; Henry; Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 12:42AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Floyd, northwestern Henry, southwestern Franklin and eastern Patrick Counties through 115 AM EDT... At 1242 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rocky Knob Summit, or near Woolwine, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Stuart... Floyd... Bassett... Ferrum... Woolwine... Willis... and Endicott. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
